comments.body: Agreed

I can't decide if I'd want it

  • on the item like in the inventory and other places where it is shown
  • centred below the item in a way more specifically designed for glancability
  • on a screen for some sort of "advanced shelf" (doesn't feel very Minecraft though)
  • as a comparator output (does it already do this? guess it is a bit too advanced)
  • as a menu, eg when you right click the bottom or top of the shelf it can show a GUI with the items akin to a hopper, where you can then reorganize more conveniently. This might take away from the intended experience of a shelf though

but I do want this
Good news -- an NBT based format is now implemented in 1.21.6-pre1. Booleans are always bytes, strings are always strings, and numbers are always floats.

maybe make it 2

then iron and gold adds 1 per armour piece.

and diamond and netherite adds 2 per armour piece.
I think the last one could be difficult to add, but I really like all this ideas! :D

"I think the last one could be difficult to add, but I really like all this ideas! :D"

First of all thank you, and second of all, after a bit of thinking yeah, I agree. It’s essentially “smart routing”, which I can see why people would say it doesn’t feel vanilla or why it might be difficult to implement, though I do know a Plugin that implemented this well, but I'm not sure whether or not it would actually work in vanilla.

Maybe instead it would be better to make it so that you can simply switch tracks by pressing W A S D on your keyboard. For instance, you’re starting at stop A, and there is a junction ahead of you; the left side goes to stop B and the right side goes to stop C. You want to go to stop C, so you simply press “D” (or whatever your keybind for going right is), and it switches you to that track.

I can see this becoming an issue with larger railway systems however, where you could have several junctions after one another, essentially forcing you to play Where’s Wally with less than 2 seconds of reaction time between junctions, or worse.

I suppose one way to mitigate this is my Better Furnace Carts idea, which would allow you to slow-down ahead of junctions, so perhaps it wouldn’t be that big a problem.

I'm not sure how vanilla the furnace minecart controls could be, but I think that a way you could do it is maybe have the same kind of setup that the beacon UI has to control it, or you could make the furnace minecart stop on unpowered powered rails. Other than that, these ideas are very good! I wrote the feedback about the chain link minecarts so that's the feature I really want in the game, but these would be a great supplement to that. 

 

edit: that was sent twice. I apologize for that

This sounds like you want the minecarts to be have extremely lazy automatic features. I don't think that is in the sense of the tinkering nature of minecraft. The chaining of minecarts however sounds very useful, or if they make a chest minecart the player can ride at the same time, like the chest boat. That would allow for more reliable faster ticketing systems to program the destination in your rail system

Der Grund, warum sie diese Änderung vorgenommen haben, bestand darin, es zugänglicher zu machen, da Kaninchen nicht immer Haut geben und sie nicht in allen Biomen vorkommen. Vielleicht wäre es eine bessere Option, die Menge an Leder auf 3 statt 1 zu erhöhen

Two things should be achieved; bundles should be easier to get early game and rabbit hide should have a viable use. If I can only have one, I wand bundles to be easier to get early game. But I think we can have both; have the rabbit hide version make multiple bundles per craft (3 or 4) or as was also suggested here, have the leather recipe take 3 leather and the rabbit recipe take 1 rabbit hide.

Also, they can just make bundles availible from other places; make Leatherworker Villagers sell bundles or rabbit hide and add bundles to structure loot pools like trial chamber, shipwrecks, etc. so early players can just find a few in the world from exploring, regardless of biome.
this is the perfect solution to the recent changes - it would be fun to have a similar system with copper buttons too

Storing multiple unstackables in a single slot certainly would be a nice change although I feel like instead of introducing an entirely new item to the game, a change to the bundle might be better. Perhaps something along the lines of: holds up to 64 ITEMS (not considefing the size of a stack) but only up to 5 slots. Obviously it would need more polish than that but you get the idea. It would also finally give the rabbit, leather thing a use case for the end game.

How does a Vex go through walls with a solid sword in hand? Just remove this feature. Moreover, the player's blade would simply pass through his intangible body. So there will be more alignment between Vex and Allai.

I have a couple of things I want to say about the bamboo blocks.

Firstly, bamboo planks and bamboo mosaics are ordered weirdly in the Creative inventory. The current order is 'Bamboo Planks, Bamboo Mosaic, Bamboo Stairs, Bamboo Mosaic Stairs, Bamboo Slab, Bamboo Mosaic Slab'. I would change it to 'Bamboo Planks, Bamboo Stairs, Bamboo Slab, Bamboo Mosaic, Bamboo Mosaic Stairs, Bamboo Mosaic Slab'. This way, the two are a bit more separated. The current "overlapping" layout just confuses me. 

Secondly, I'd like to see the saturation of the new Block of Bamboo boosted a bit, to match actual bamboo a bit more closely. Not all the way, but a bit. 

Thirdly, and lastly, now that there's a Block of Stripped Bamboo, I'd change Bamboo Planks to have the same texture as other planks, since the two are currently indistinguishable from the side. I also think slabs and stairs for stripped bamboo (directional, and with the ends visible) would be cool, but that's quite besides the point. 

All in all, I'm really happy with the new update cycle. Keep up the good work!

It's really cool that we can now select the port number when opening a world to LAN

But it would also be cool if we had more parameter choices like the real servers have

I mean, it would be awesome if we could define from this screen the MOTD, allow or not allow PvP
I love the new additions to bamboo! Though that one darker pixel on the blocks of bamboo and stripped bamboo is gonna drive me crazy

Expand the snowAccumulationHeight topic. Snow could accumulate to any height by default, but the average would be ~1.5 blocks for very cold biomes and ~0.5 blocks for moderately cold ones. "Balancing" will occur due to the layer-by-layer disappearance (melting) of snow, in clear weather. So the surface will change over time, but remain smooth and uniform, while not perfectly flat.
This has chat reporting, therefore it is a bad snapshot.
Remove Chat Reporting from the next Snapshot, and I'll have a reason to play it!

1.19.3 Idea!

Since the next Minecraft Update will be focused around quality of life,I think it would be nice to modify the Warden Spawn Egg texture.

I was thinking a lot about that since a few days now and I think the texture reflects more the tendrils than the main body,which is dark Grey.So my suggestion would be to keep the light cyan parts as the overlay and put the body texture as the base.

Thank you in advance :D
porção de levitação, que permita no modo survival que o jogador se mova no ar como no modo criativo po 20 minutos.

Since empty spawners are now available, it would be nice if they would drop when using Silk Touch on an existing spawner. The empty spawner could then be used as a decorative block.

Since spawn eggs are not available in survival, the gameplay impact of this change has been mitigated.

Expand the snowAccumulationHeight topic. Snow could accumulate to any height by default, but the average would be ~1.5 blocks for very cold biomes and ~0.5 blocks for moderately cold ones. "Balancing" will occur due to the layer-by-layer disappearance (melting) of snow, in clear weather. So the surface will change over time, but remain smooth and uniform, while not perfectly flat.

I have three main points of feedback. 

  1. Bamboo planks and bamboo mosaics are ordered weirdly in the Creative inventory. The current order is 'Bamboo Planks, Bamboo Mosaic, Bamboo Stairs, Bamboo Mosaic Stairs, Bamboo Slab, Bamboo Mosaic Slab'. I would change it to 'Bamboo Planks, Bamboo Stairs, Bamboo Slab, Bamboo Mosaic, Bamboo Mosaic Stairs, Bamboo Mosaic Slab'. This way, the two are a bit more separated. The current "overlapping" layout just confuses me. 
  2. The 'snowAccumulationHeight' game rule is great! But I'd increase the upper limit to 16 or 32, just for the possibility of some extreme weather over time. I'd also make negative values allow snow to fall on full blocks of snow layers, effectively allowing snow to pile up forever. Obviously not a very practical use, but a fun one. 
  3. Lastly, I think the 'waterSourceConversion' and 'lavaSourceConversion' game rules be dimension-specific, allowing, for example, the Nether to renew lava but not the Overworld. Perhaps an additional field after the true/false for the dimension. If no dimension is specified, it applies the change to all 3, or just the current one. 

Lastly, I just want to say that this snapshot is amazing. I especially like the explosion-related game rules. I can finally make creepers give me back that wall they blew up!

The gamrule about the snow layer is really great, having a value of 3 for exemple can make the terrain in cold biomes much more detailed, I think this gamerule should now be at an higher value, that would be awesome to have a smoother terrain by default

Also, speaking of the snow, it would be really cool if there was the snowlogging system from Bedrock, having flowers and grass that make random hole in the snow with a flower/grass in the middle isn't great, the snowlogging would be so cool

Loving the new snapshot spawn eggs! Though I think the Snow Golem spawn egg should have some orange! I think the Creative inventory still needs some tweaking as well, just so it lines up in menu. Perhaps move doors and trapdoors to their own area below wood and planks?
^^ Or move the wood in place of trapdoors and doors
The OP only items should be reordered. The debug stick is a tool that goes in the utility items tab. The light, structure void, and barrier blocks should be moved to the utility blocks tab.

The chiselled bookshelf needs serious work. (I've tried making a separate thread about this but it just keeps getting deleted)

The fact that you have to take out every single book just to get the first one out makes the block both extremely unintuitive and not easy to use. Thanks to the game's current inventory issues, you're not even likely to have 6 slots available to take said books out.

Mojang appear to have taken a "Good enough" approach to adding this feature, which just isn't good enough, and the choices they made have rendered this item nearly unusable for its functional purpose.

We Just need structure blocks illusioner and giant mob eggs in the creative inventory and then I think we would have every item available in there also I wish Wither and Ender Dragon eggs were in the creative inventory too i know they said that they did not want people to accidentally destroy their builds so they should make it a option when you create a new world that is always set as off so you would have to manually turn it on

In the last 2 snapshots the game menu script in the pause screen has been moved down and the whole pause screen settings are now offset downwards, I would like them to be centered again, perhaps bring the game menu script up again as it was in 1.19.2 and in the previous versions.

 

The creative inventory on the other hand is well organised now, however I think that the diamond sword should be the icon for the weapons section.

 

An option to keep the old inventory layout would be a welcome addition.

I agree with you, however I think OP only items should have their own inventory tab.

This is actually a good idea.

Simple and would be fun to have it. I wonder if something like "is this a time frame?" could work as well. Or maybe "Having a time frame".

I just really like the idea of "time frame" being a pun lol.

I think I speak for others when I say the implementation of The Warden dropping a Sculk Catalyst on death defeats the purpose of The Warden.

The Warden is meant to be avoided and not actively farmed, plus Sculk Catalysts are plentiful in Deep Dark Biomes that there isn't really a need to farm a mob just to obtain them. Part of what makes the Warden special is that there is no reward for straight-up fighting it, but rather avoiding it through deception, failure to do so should result in your death.

The decision is all up to you but I would revert the Warden dropping a Catalyst and the ranged damage back to 30. The Warden originally was meant to spell doom if you fail to play by its rules, break the rules and suffer the consequences of your actions.

Are fireflies not going to be added simply because it's poisonous to frogs? We can simply prevent frogs from eating them. The birch forest update only adds an extra log on birch trees, and some new deco blocks like fungi and hanging moss, which should be easy to implement. I feel like there's too much of a perfectionist nature in Mojang lately, that features need to be top tier and with perfect iconic graphics before they're added to the game. This might be one reason why updates are too slow?

I think the Nether Update is an exemplary example of a good update. Netherite to encourage exploration, bastions and brutes as challenge, new beautiful biomes, piglins as nether villagers... I'm hoping that future updates can be just as good, rivalling the best of Minecraft mods. Right now the Deep Dark doesn't have a unique, enticing reward. Recovery compass and music disc feels too much like a novelty collectible and not actually useful like netherite or elytra. It doesn't have to be a game-breaking upgrade, even a sidegrade like a speedy armor or thorns shield is fine, just make it unique?

Maybe the reason why ancient cities have mediocre loot, why fireflies aren't added, is because of the dreaded "minecraft vanilla" formula, that stuff needs to fit perfectly to be in the base game, and changes need to be small. We can't have shiny new equipment, mobs and d1mensions because it's too "modlike", but I strongly disagree with that stance. It's necessary to stray from the minecraft vanilla formula to make a better game that remains relevant for decades to come. Minecraft gained a surge of popularity after these modlike changes like update aquatic and raids.

The reasoning for not adding vertic@ s1abs, sh@@rks and @l1igators have always been weak. Limiting creativity? They increase creativity by adding more options, if anything. Teaching kids that these animals are nice? Minecraft shouldn't be a PETA education game, it should stay as a survival game where you do what you gotta do to survive.

This perfectionist stance is holding minecraft back. Hytale is adding all these features that minecraft players have always wanted, and they get praise for it. Mojang will eventually lose to competitors if they're too stubborn with these.

If updates are slow because of lag and bug fixes, then I can understand that. Bedrock edition has some critical bugs that need to be fixed. I'm still gonna thank the devs for making free updates, and will continue to support them with purchases.

I personally don't mind wardens dropping catalyst. Most players won't farm them as it's easier to get it from the biome. Renewable drops is fun for tech players, and I hope there will be more drops for other mobs.

Also, regarding the "limiting creativity" reason? Creativity is a very rare thing as most players don't know how to make a good-looking house. If players prefer to live in generated structures like castles, or have an NPC build them a good house, please let them. "One block at a time" seems like a questionable principle, as instant gratification is what make games fun. Having to google and learn how to build houses is not fun for a lot of players, and it's painfully slow too.

There's also an issue with furrn1ture in minecraft. Using signs and item frames to create them, they look terrible and laggy in large amounts. Hytale is also adding functional furrn1ture, and they look really good in homes.

I personally like to think of the warden as a boss and something very useful to come from it. It has more than the Wither or Ender Dragon so that technically would make it a boss. Also all the other bosses give a good drop. With the Ender Dragon you get a crap ton of XP and a trophy. With the wither you get the nether star. So I think it is kind of a ripoff that you just get a common item. If you do kill the warden I think you should get something good or at least a trophy but if you see the warden as a unkillable mob and have it drop something common then you do you. I just want it to have a better drop. Also will we have copper horn soon on java?

I really like the root blocks, but they don't have any properties that are truly unique. This would be perfect!

Totally agree. Went wither-skeleton hunting today and I got REAL sick of dealing with blazes, peeking out sloooowwwwly from behind pillars and retreating slooooowwwwly cause I don't want to redraw my bow and then getting hit a whole lot cause they're faster than anything I can do. As it is now, I feel the enchantment's uses are pretty limited: dealing with ancient cities, hiding from people in multiplayer, building walls and elevated paths. It would be a whole lot more powerful and a huge QOL improvement to other areas of the game if you could eat and drink and block and aim faster as well rather than just sneaking. I don't know whether I agree about it also affecting crawl speed but I guess I don't really have an opinion.

This would be a very interesting new mechanic, if being next to a water source is too much, being directly beneath a water source would definitely be a good idea.

I'm not sure of how this would affect the gameplay if at all, but I'm sure that some people within the redstone community could make some really fun and interesting machines with this kind of mechanic.

I would like more for it to break blocks, but only when in the final anger stage. That would make it difficult to pillar up and impossible to just hide behind a wall. It could roar and throw its arms forward and break a 3x3 in front of it. That would also help with it getting stuck on dripstone all the time.

I mean, it can dig itself in and out of solid rock in a matter of seconds, why shouldn't it be able to punch through a wall.
Honestly I like the consistency it’s at now plus you can void them it’s not like ever ten blocks there one in your way

Bumping this.  It would also be super helpful if the probability/density of noise caves was more easily accessible to datapack makers.  It is super straightforward to reduce carver caves, but not noise caves.
I agree. There are so many holes in the ground that lead into massive caves, it kinda ruins the beauty of the otherwise smooth landscape.

maybe add sculk traps so when a player is being chased by a warden it gets trapped by the sculk trap for 20 or 30 seconds it might make fighting the warden a bit difficult  and this is optional to add in the 1.19 update ok 

p.s this game is awesome I wonder how it'll be in the next update
